pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:0.5: 11. The training rule on heavy cloaks
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.2: At that time the nun Thullanandā was a learned reciter, and she was confident and skilled at giving teachings.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.3: On one occasion when the weather was cold, King Pasenadi of Kosala put on an expensive woolen cloak and went to Thullanandā. He bowed and sat down.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.4: And Thullanandā instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.7: “Great king, if you wish to give me something, then give me this woolen cloak.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.8: The king gave her his cloak. He then got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated her with his right side toward her, and left.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.10: “These nuns have great desires; they are not content.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.11: How can they ask the king for his woolen cloak?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.12: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.13: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.14: “How could Venerable Thullanandā ask the king for his woolen cloak?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.15: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā asked for this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.18: “How could the nun Thullanandā ask the king for his woolen cloak?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.20: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.21.1: ‘If a nun carries out an exchange to get a heavy cloak, it is to be worth at most four _kaṁsa_ coins. If she gets one in exchange that is worth more than that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.2: whatever cloak is used in cold weather.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.3: Carries out an exchange to get:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.5: It is to be worth at most four _kaṁsa_ coins:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.6: it may be worth sixteen _kahāpaṇa_ coins.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.7: If she gets one in exchange that is worth more than that:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.8: if she asks for one worth more than that, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.9: When she gets it, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.10: It is to be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.11: “And, monks, it’s to be relinquished like this.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.12: (To be expanded as in Nuns’ Relinquishment 1, [](pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.21--2.1.43), with appropriate substitutions.)
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.13: ‘Venerables, this heavy cloak worth more than four _kaṁsa_ coins, which I got in exchange, is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.2.1: If it is worth more than four _kaṁsa_ coins, and she perceives it as such, and she gets it in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.2.2: If it is worth more than four _kaṁsa_ coins, but she is unsure of it, and she gets it in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.2.3: If it is worth more than four _kaṁsa_ coins, but she perceives it as being worth less, and she gets it in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.2.4: If it is worth less than four _kaṁsa_ coins, but she perceives it as being worth more, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.2.5: If it is worth less than four _kaṁsa_ coins, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.2.6: If it is worth less than four _kaṁsa_ coins, and she perceives it as such, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.3.2: if she carries out an exchange for one worth at most four _kaṁsa_ coins;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.3.3: if she carries out an exchange for one worth less than four _kaṁsa_ coins;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.3.5: if it is from those who have given an invitation;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.3.6: if it is for the benefit of someone else;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.3.7: if it is by means of her own property;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.3.8: if she gets one in exchange that has little value from someone who wants to exchange one of great value;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.3.10: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.3.11: The eleventh training rule is finished.
